name: The Ritz-Carlton Lodge, Reynolds Plantation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: beautiful resort. probably 1 of the nicest of the ritz hotels we've been to. gorgeous grounds, holiday lights were stunning, and the huge, walk-in gingerbread house inside the lobby was a treat for my 7yo daughter. the resort was quiet and peaceful yet unpretentious. i'm sure it helped, though, that the hotel was low on occupancy during our stay the week before x-mas.
reviews.title: Excellent stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006
reviews.text: we spent a day on the lake in a brand new pontoon boat rented through the marina - a definate "must-do." also don't miss the nightly smores/hot chocolate bonfire, which was always fun.
reviews.title: Poor Customer Service, but Beautiful Place to Visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: our room was on the club level, which also was very nice. awesome breakfast and 4 other food "presentations" throughout the day. although alcohol isn't formally out and openly available 24/7, as it is at most other locations, the club concierge was always happy to get me whatever i requested. a concierge was present in the club lounge all the time, always smiling and ready to help. actually, the staff throughout the property couldnt have been nicer. every single employee had a smile, said hello and asked how we were every time we passed! OK, once i had to wait 3 or so minutes for the concierge downstairs, and once i actually had to open the front door myself as the valet couldnt get to it in time, and once they brought me the wrong car (I shouldve taken it as it was nicer than mine) - but I honestly thought that the service was first rate.
reviews.title: Beautiful spot, just not quite up to Ritz reputation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: food in the lobby bar was good, and linger longer also was good, but not great. lots of other restaurants to choose from, though, just a short drive from the hotel.
reviews.title: Better than I expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: our room was very nice - spotless and nicely done, as was the gym and spa.
reviews.title: Beautiful, relaxing retreat

likes.disliked: — cheesy shampoos and conditioners -- for a Ritz property, sub par!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Celebrated my wife's birthday with a weekend trip to The Lodge. Wonderful rustic building on Lake Oconee. Service was excellent. Booked club level, upgraded to an executive suite, wonderful! Club level worth the dollars for breakfast & lunch. Spa was great but pricey. We had a rainy weekend that made the indoor pool & spa facilities much appreciated. Great weekend getaway from our Atlanta home. Can't wait to return.
reviews.title: Relaxing Birthday Celebration

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Business meetings are what brought me to this amazing property. The golf courses are awesome, the multitude of fine homes in the area is mind boggling - so much wealth in this area. Grab a bike, or their Segway's and see the surrounding area. The trails were well groomed and excellent for walking, jogging or biking. The pool area outside was fantastic for adults. My room was beautiful, the food was excellent considering that they were cooking for our group of over 200. Hotel bars were nice, so also was the option of simply finding an available chiminea near the shore, building my own fire and smoking a nice cigar while sipping a beverage or two. I'd gladly return to this fine hotel for either business reasons or a family retreat.
reviews.title: Beautiful grounds and wonderful resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The combo of a recession and a slow season add up to great deals at the Ritz Carlton Reynolds Plantation. Our room was $249 a night but included a $50 resort credit and free breakfast at Georgia's restaurant (about a $45 value). Unlike some others here, our bill was correct at checkout. They even let us take some bikes out for free ($40 value).
reviews.title: A relaxing escape!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staying at a hotel in dead season has some negatives but the Ritz Reynolds Plantation was still superlative with service. Being younger and self-sufficient, I don't really want people carrying my bags and parking my car because I would rather do it myself. I made the mistake of trying to do it myself and I don't recommend doing that here because I ended up getting lost finding my room and couldn't find the self-parking easily and ended up in an employee lot. In the future, I'll just let them park my car, pay the fees/tips, and let someone else bring my bags to the room.
reviews.title: Lovely accomodations but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The room itself is nice with a large bathroom. Lots of great Bvlgari products so hide them in your bag if you want them refilled so you can stock up! Each room has a nice balcony to sit out on and the beds are pretty comfortable although far from the most comfortable I've slept in. I wasn't blown away by the room.
reviews.title: Save your money & stay somewhere else
Pleasant Enough
reviews.text: As a Ritz, it's fine..the attempted service is as expected even though execution is not always there...

reviews.title: This is a great family get away...
reviews.text: Nice accommodations and the rooms are adequate.....

reviews.title: Mostly, Ritzy
reviews.text: However, if you feel like being gouged for everything, then this is the place..from significantly overpriced food to the $16 movie in the room....for some reason, staying at an "upscale" place has nothing to do with swank and more to do with being overcharged and underserved (poor spa treatment, mediocre food, etc.)

reviews.title: Great Place for Business Planning Meeting
reviews.text: Nice location outside of Atlanta...mostly convenient to get to....property is nice...

reviews.title: Very relaxing
reviews.text: This is a great family get away. It feels like going to the lake house when I was a kid - of course this is much more refined in a Ritzy kind of way. I love the lodge feel and the warm fires at night. Kids played golf and I went to the spa for "me" time. The restaurant helps remind you of being in the South and the warm service, comfortable setting and smiles will make this a annual stop.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at some very nice hotels including other Ritz Carltons and The Four Seasons and this consistently ranks as one of my personal favorites. The staff in the Concierge Lounge is gracious, hospitable and remembers me by name on each stay. Very few properties seem able to deliver this level of service any more. The property gives you great views of Lake Oconee with a beautiful Infinity pool. Linger Longer Steakhouse has incredible steaks and sides. However, Georgia's Restaurant still fails to deliver the 5 star meal most often found in Ritz Carlton's signature properties. Nonetheless, this is a perfect property for a romantic weekend with your spouse/partner.
reviews.title: The Best of the Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is becautiful and serene, but I didn't feel that the hotel was much better than a Marriott. We could hear everything through the walls and the decor and style of the room is exactly what you'd get for a Marriott or Hilton. I always thought the Ritz was supposed to be a little nicer, but I wasn't impressed. Not that it was bad, it was just average.
reviews.title: very beautiful, but not worth the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was good at the on-site restaurants (especially the Linger Longer steakhouse), but we had one bad experience with a server/busser at the Georgia restaurant. My place setting did not include a knife, and when I asked for one she gave me an exasperated sigh. I've worked in food service before, so I would normally understand, but they weren't even busy!
reviews.title: Relaxing Getaway Weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The nightly s'more at the fire pit was a nice touch, as well as the chiminea and fire pits along the shore of the lake. If the rooms were quieter and nicer, I'd have been very satisfied.
reviews.title: Great Until the End: A Argument Over an Hour from (an Alleged) a 5-Star Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: My wife and I had the privilege of spending a long weekend at Reynolds Plantation in April 2009. Having heard nothing but great things about this resort we were quite excited. Reynolds certainly did not disappoint.
reviews.title: Beautiful place all the way around

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: My wife and I traveled to the Ritz Carlton at Reynolds Plantation for her yearly Risk Managers meeting.This is a wonderful place but you need to carry lots of cash or be on the company dime. The staff at the Ritz is the friendliest I have ever encountered and the food served was for the meetings was absolutely great, but again not cheap. we had a chance to walk around the place one afternoon (it is a bit off the beaten path about a 20 minute ride south of Exit 130 on I-20). After walking around Lake Oconee, we decided to have a drink at the outdoor bar (Gaby's). My wife ordered a peach daiquiri and myself a draft beer. The tab came to $17. Again the wait staff was extremely friendly but i guess at these prices you can afford (pun intended) to be. My only complaint was that we were told the valet parking was complimentary but there was a charge of $18 for one day of parking.
reviews.title: Great Place Uber Expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stay at the Lake Oconee Ritz Carlton several times a year since it is close to our home. We usually opt for the club level and this time enjoyed being in the Ritz Carlton Suite. Joann and Linda, who work in the club lounge, provide excellent service.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort with excellent service!
Beautiful surroundings, service needs some help
reviews.text: I definitely recommend the spa. The atmosphere is very relaxing and the indoor pool is incredible.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I have stayed at this resort multiple times and am in love with the setting. Situated directly on Lake Oconee and surrounded by golf courses, trees, grass and more trees, it is simply beautiful. Think natural beauty. It is a wonderful, easy retreat from Atlanta - yet feels like you are a world away.
reviews.title: A Fabulous Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: It's a little hard to imagine a large luxury resort basically located in the middle of nowhere and that may be why my only (but major) gripe is the level of service. It is inconsistent. Some employees are incredibly attentive, genuine and polished while others (read: most) appear clueless and aloof.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel but all employees literally held their hand out for tips -- just for opening the door!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The purpose of this Labor Day weekend trip to the Ritz was two-fold.
reviews.title: Not as Peaceful as it Looks!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: (1) to get some much needed R&R and
reviews.title: Great Property! Need to add staff for cleaning/maintainence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: (2) to determine if Reynolds Planation was a place we might want to buy a vacation home or eventually retire.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, friendly staff, thin walls

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009
reviews.text: As for the R&R part of the trip:
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel
Wonderful weekend getaway - a perfect stay
reviews.text: - We've stayed at a number of Ritz Carlton's and this is the first Ritz we've stayed where the number of children out numbered adults by 3-4x. We actually thought (crazy us) that with school starting or having started, we might be fortunate to have the place mostly to ourselves. Not the case. The hotel is over run (and I mean over run) by children. Little hands in all the buffet food (picking up food with bare hands then putting it back - touching everything), running through dining rooms, running through the halls of the hotel, scream in rooms, jumping on beds, misbehaving at the pool. We laid awake at night listening to screaming children playing in the room next to us - it was so loud that we thought they were throwing furniture. I asked my husband is this the Ritz or Motel 6? Where are the parents? I know I'll get a lot of negative comments to my review, but it needs to be said......the parents are as spoiled as the children. I never heard one parent correct their child - it was a free for all. The parents were as demanding as the children. "Hey You" to the wait staff was common. I even overhead a guest trying to throw his money around "money is no object" to get himself booked for golf on labor day weekend (because he hadn't planned ahead). When he was told no (3 times by 3 different people) - you would have thought he'd never heard the word "no" before.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton Reynolds Plantation for one night during the holidays. The exterior of the hotel and surrounding were wrapped in while lights, it was absolutely stunning. This RC is a bit more rustic than the classic RG. Walking in the hallway leading to the hotel room, we noticed marks on the walls possibly from housekeeping carts. Inside the hotel room, by the dresser, we noticed pretty quickly two torn areas of carpet near the dresser. We wondered how this torn carpt had been missed by maintenance. The room left us wondering when the room was last throughly cleaned by evidenced of the dust on the phone and on the headboards and the dirty bathtub fixture. While the inside left much to be desired, the nightime campfire making smores and fires along the lake side were memorable.
reviews.title: Beautiful on the outside but not in the inside

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: This Ritz Carlton is the perfect setting for the holidays. The entire property is lit with white lights, while inside the lodge there is always at least one roaring fire and a gingerbread house big enough to stand in.
reviews.title: Beautiful setting with superb customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While the property is gorgeous, the most impressive part of the Ritz is the impeccable service. Every member of the staff that we came into contact with was extremely friendly and helpful. The restaurant was happy to serve us breakfast even though we arrived 15 minutes after they were supposed to stop serving.
reviews.title: Wonderful Getaway!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Finally, there is no lack of activities for the kids. Kid-friendly films are shown around the clock, and there is a nightly bonfire with all the fixings for smores. In all, a great holiday!
reviews.title: Perfect for a relaxing getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I went away for a long weekend -- our first trip away from our nearly two year old twin girls (so it wouldn't have taken much for me to have a good time!). But, from beginning to end we had a wonderful time. The service was excellent. The Lodge upgraded us to the Club level where we were able to eat and drink at all times of the day, and that made it extra special, but even without that, I think the hotel's attention to detail would have surpassed my expectations.
reviews.title: Peaceful Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Ritz for three nights in early October. An optimal time if you don't like crowds. Very quiet. As with our other Ritz experience, the staff can't do enough for you, seem always genuinely pleasant. Rooms were first class. Dedicated walking/jogging trails. We don't golf, but course appeared in great shape. Only negative as you are out in nowhere is no DVD or video players in room; asked if we could rent a DVD player and were told it would cost $100; could have purchased one for less. Well, one other negative is paying for parking, which is valet only. Since this is isolated property, the requirement for valet only seems unnecessary; having an option of self-parking as one can do at the Ritz in Naples, Fl should be available.
reviews.title: Relaxing and beautiful

likes.disliked: — Charging for parking and no DVD/VIdeo players in rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: My husband stayed here for a week attending a conference and I joined him for the last 2 days. This hotel is very consistent with other RC's in terms of service and quality.
reviews.title: Lived up to expectations
Absolutely amazing - exceeded every expectation!
reviews.text: My husband and I just got home from our trip to this hotel and I must say we had the most amazing time. From the minute we arrived, we were treated like royalty. The service was exceptional and the hotel was gorgeous. We were at the hotel to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary. When we checked in, the front desk knew we were celebrating a special occasion so they upgraded us from a resort view room to a lake view room. It was perfect. Then when we came back to our room after dinner and smores, we found that the staff had covered our room and bed with rose petals. There was a nice note congratulating us on our anniversary and thanking us for choosing to celebrate at the Ritz. It was a lovely and unexpected surprise. The only complaint I have about the hotel was the bed. The linens were a little scratchy - nothing like what you would expect from a 5 star hotel. Other than that one little thing, our stay was incredible. We will certainly be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second stay at this hotel. The previous visit was to celebrate a birthday and this visit was to celebrate our anniversary. On both visits we found special chocolate dessert plates waiting in our room with personalized welcome cards. The hotel and grounds are beautiful. The "lodge" atmosphere fits perfectly with the location, which is lakeside in rural Georgia. We have dined at all the restaurants and found them to be nothing less than superb. The Linger Longer Steakhouse offers especially great steaks and don't miss the Godiva chocolate souffle. Gaby's by the lake offers large portions in a completely casual setting. Just sitting by the infinity pool looking out over the lake is hard to beat. The pool staff provided chair covers and towels, as well as delivering drinks and food poolside. You actually never have to leave your chair. My wife enjoyed the spa and said that everything was great from the facility to the treatment she received. I don't really golf or fish but both are widely available and this is a golf destination. Our room was on the 4th floor overlooking the grounds and lake. There were no problems with the condition of the room and for all practical purposes it appeared to be in perfect shape. Prices are what is to be expected at a Ritz Carlton. The area around Lake Oconee is under development and there are a few new shopping centers with various restaurants. There is also a new movie theater nearby but we did not have a chance to visit it. If you just want to relax and stay on the grounds for meals, we found the Ritz Carlton Reynolds Plantation to be perfect. Sitting by the pool during the day, sitting by the lake during the evening, and the free smores by the fire pit at night was exactly the relaxation we were looking for.
reviews.title: Complete Relaxation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our trip was a delayed honeymoon. My husband loves to golf and I love the pool/lake thing. This fit what we both wanted. If you stay on Saturday night during May - October, they have a cocktail cruise from 5-7 for free. You get drinks and light appetizers. They just started this. One of the waiters at Gabby's mentioned it. I was glad we did this. You need to make a reservation as only the first 40 to sign-up can go. Speaking of Gabby's, the atmosphere is great. I love the rustic look. The servings are big. My husband and I could have split the turkey wrap. We also tried the nachos and homemade chips. We thought everything was good. My turkey wrap was $15 to give you an idea on the prices.
reviews.title: Beautiful setting would definitely go again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: There is a nice walking trail. I also swam a couple of times in the lap pool. I had the pool to myself.
reviews.title: Overall it is pretty good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: We took in the chiminea dinner lakeside. Here you are served dinner lakeside on adirondack chairs with a chimnae in front of you. Included in the price is a champagne toast. I enjoyed this. The week we stayed the temperature was over 100 degrees. So, at a cooler temperature, my husband may have enjoyed more. We had steak. They bring it out in a covered skillet. To do it again, we would have asked for a step more rare than usual. My theory is the steak cooks a bit more in the covered skillet during the travel from the kitchen to the lake. We still found the food to be very good. You are close to the sidewalk around the hotel. So, you are only a few feet from the activity of the hotel. This didn't bother me; however, my husband did think we would have more privacy.
reviews.title: Unclean!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I visited this hotel to celebrate our 11th anniversary. This was our second time visiting the property and it is still perfect! The staff was attentive and went out of their way to accomodate every one of our requests. This was the first time we have stayed on the Club level at a Ritz. For approx. $100 more per night, you get several food and beverage presentations each day, including wine and champage at cocktail time. This hotel really is top notch and the fact that it is on 75 miles from home makes it that much better. We will certainly be back, but not soon enough!
reviews.title: Still Perfect!
Surprisingly well-designed and also well-managed
reviews.text: Knowing the inherent value of The Ritz-Carlton Club Level (4-5 extensive complimentary food and beverage options every day, comp Internet, Concierge service, upgraded amenities, extra privacy, more) that's where we stayed on our first visit to the Ritz-Carlton Reynolds Plantation. First, this resort is supremely convenient to Atlanta and especially the ATL airport. Second, the setting is, no hyperbole, stunning. So close to such a major city yet tranquil and gorgeous: large lake, beautiful trees, meticulously groomed golf course, convenient services (Publix, etc.). Third, the resort is thoughtfully designed with a separate but convenient and completely equipped spa and fitness center plus indoor lap pool, and variety of dining options, including the creative Chiminea lakefront private option which is worth the $125++ per person price. Furnishings, amenities and service are typical Ritz-Carlton, and that is an accolade, are what drove us to choose this resort, and did not disappoint. Only constructive comment is that the outdoor pool f&b service could be a little more attentive. For all of this, the room rates available in July on ritzcarlton.com represent tremendous value. In the immortal words of Mikey: "Try it, you'll like it!"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010
reviews.text: Beautiful and relaxing place.
reviews.title: Wonderful Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything is perfect here. We've never been more comfortable or better treated. The staff are consummate professionals. They make you feel like you are special and like they have been waiting just for you. The chefs will cater to your whims and even come out for a visit. If you are a walker or runner, take a map and stay off the golf trails; they're pretty territorial. This place is head and shoulders above everyone else. We've been three times and it just doesn't get old. We expected a lot from this chain and it exceeded our expectations.
reviews.title: This really is a 5-star hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife, daughter and I just returned from a fabulous trip to The Ritz at Reynolds Plantation. Our experience could not have been more perfect. Johnny, the Doorman has been there a number of years and he always has a smile and is extremely personable. Another terrific associate is Walter who is a bellman there and has been on staff for at least 4 years. He always remembers my wife and I each time we return. We stayed on the Club Level and the staff there is always excellent but my favorite person is Joanne. Joanne always takes time to get to know each guest and the service delivered by the Club Level staff is second to none. We can't wait to return in 8 more weeks. Love the Ritz !!!!!
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort on Lake Oconee

aka: The Ritz-Carlton Lodge, Reynolds Plantation Hotel Greensboro
description: Just 75 miles from Atlanta and the world’s busiest airport, a stunning lake shimmers in quiet tranquility. Cradled by verdant hills where pines tower to the sky and eagles dance with the sun, this secluded getaway transports guests to a place far away from daily cares and pressures. It’s little wonder that the family born to this land called it Linger Longer. Once here, guests yearn to stay, whether for golfing on championship courses, netting their daily limit of fish, discovering uncommon shops in antebellum towns or enjoying a delightful roster of outdoor activities. Amidst this engaging backdrop, the commanding presence of The Ritz-Carlton Lodge, Reynolds Plantation offers an elegant invitation to meet in the heart of nature. The Ritz-Carlton Lodge offers guests legendary service highlighted by gracious Southern hospitality.
